content: #16020 adds a CI step to keep track of the evolution of the sizes of the oleans in a PR (and on master). The main reason for this is to catch PRs that produce very large oleans and hence highlight potential issues.
However, the current status of the PR just computes the values and compares them to master. There is no action taken based on the information, other than a summary.
@Matthew Ballard suggested to provide some benchmark for it before merging, but setting this up is not easy.
What do you think of trying this out, collecting the information during the first few days in which the step is active and then see how to proceed?

By the way, since the PR has been on hold for a while, it ran a comparison between the sizes of the oleans from last month and now: below are the files with a difference of at least 5% in size.
